intro: Hoya forbesii, commonly known as the "Chinese everlasting," is a tropical epiphytic plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and clusters of star-shaped, waxy flowers. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptical, with a smooth, glossy surface. Hoya forbesii produces fragrant, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is a slow-growing plant that thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil.
